alert.note: Alert for El Paso; Hudspeth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 29 at 5:49AM CDT until May 29 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TODAY AND ON MONDAY... .An approaching upper level system will create strong southwest winds this afternoon. Winds look to become gusty in the higher terrain locations as stronger winds aloft move over the area, especially over the Gila Region and Sacramento Mountains. This afternoon humidity values will be very low. A very dry spring has led to extremely dry fuels over much of southern New Mexico and far west Texas. These elevated to critical fire weather conditions are expected to persist through Monday with winds strengthening in the afternoon hours and afternoon humidity values remaining extremely dry. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW HUMIDITY AND STRONG WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 055 AND 056... * WIND...Southwest winds of 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * HUMIDITY...5 to 10%. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended. Please check with the local agencies for updated burn ban information.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
